item.title: All Mythic Boss Fight Locations in Fortnite Super
item.description:
Fortnite Super has a few boss fights that players can find in the Battle Royale map, and it's the first time in Chapter 6 Season 3 where Shogun X does not appear. With 3 boss fights in Fortnite Chapter 6 Season 3, players are going to want to know where to find them all, how to beat them all, and what loot each of them provides, so players know which boss fight is worth their time.

With some exciting boss fights in Fortnite featuring in Chapter 6 Season 3, players are going to want to bring their best weapons if they are to fight against these challenging foes and obtain their heroic loot for a victory royale.

Mask Maker Daigo Location

Where to Find Daigo in Fortnite

  • Location: Demon's Domain, the middle south POI
  • Loot: Infernal Defenses Medallion, Enhanced Spire Rifle

Mask Maker Daigo is the central boss fight of Chapter 6, Season 3, and he can always be found in the central dojo in Demon's Domain. While the area is swarming with Daigo's minions, players can ignore them and head straight for this meditating boss. Daigo has unique attack patterns where he will hone in on a player's position to dash attack or shoot a beam of energy at them, but they're easily avoided with a decent sprint and slide.

Outside of his attacks, Daigo is an easy enough kill provided that players bring SMGs, LMGs, and Assault Rifles, as players must shoot the masks surrounding Daigo to stun and weaken him. After Daigo's defeat, he will drop the Infernal Defenses Medallion, which provides passive shield regeneration and faster reload, as well as the Enhanced Spire Rifle, which has a higher fire rate and ammo count than other variants.

Overlord Spire Location

Where to Find the Overlord Spire in Fortnite

  • Location: Random POI, indicated by the dark cloud and two Spire icons on the map
  • Loot: Unstable Yoink Shotgun / Unstable Voltage Burst Pistol / Unstable Frostfire Shotgun

The Overlord Spire is a unique boss in this Super season who can be found at random POIs. Once the game starts, players need to check the map for a POI that has a dark storm cloud around it, along with a Spire icon (noted in the Legends section of the map). Like Daigo, players will need to bring LMGs, SMGs, and ARs to break the Overlord Spire's masks defenses, and be aware of the minions that spawn with every phase. The Overlord Spire isn't hard to fight, and players simply need to slide through its tracking laser beams.

After defeat, players will be rewarded with a random Unstable weapon, which could be either one of two shotguns or a burst pistol. Each of these has unique traits, like the ability to gain a speed boost on a hit or a random chance for a shockwave effect.

Kor Location

Where to Find Kor in Fortnite

  • Location: Shogun's Arena, after the 2nd storm circle.
  • Loot: Shrouded Striker Medallion, Kor's Deadeye DMR

Kor replaces Shogun X, replacing the Shogun's Arena with her hunting grounds. This area spawns randomly on the map after the 2nd storm circle, and will feature as a location in the sky that can be reached by a rift just underneath the newly spawned POI. On the island, players will find Kor, who can be shot at to trigger her boss fight, which will see her teleport away. Kor prefers to fight from a distance, so players are going to want long-range weapons like DMRs and LMGs to pick off Kor from a distance, while also finding cover from her DMR shots.

After defeat, Kor drops the Shrouded Striker Medallion, which allows players to jump further and higher, along with being granted invisibility when they sprint jump. With a stealthy medallion, players also get Kor's Deadeye DMR, which is a Mythic DMR that has enhanced critical hit damage for long-range battles.

Fortnite

item.title: Epic Games Has Added More AI NPCs to Fortnite
item.description:
Summary

  • Two new AI NPCs are available in Fortnite's LEGO Brick Life mode until June 12.
  • The AI Darth Vader NPC from the Galactic Battle mini-season interacted with players using James Earl Jones' voice.
  • SAG-AFTRA is currently suing Fortnite over its recent use of AI.

A popular content creator has spotted the appearance of two new AI NPCs in Fortnite , which will be available in the LEGO Fortnite Brick Life game mode through June 12. Fortnite recently concluded its Galactic Battle mini-season, which featured the game's largest collaboration with the Star Wars franchise so far. The mini-season introduced a wide variety of iconic characters to the game, like Mace Windu, General Grievous, and Emperor Palpatine.

Epic Games made a lot of waves during the Galactic Battle mini-season, as it surprised players by adding an AI version of the character Darth Vader. The NPC made use of an AI version of James Earl Jones' voice to talk to players. After defeating the Sith Lord in combat, he would join the players' party and become a full teammate. Gamers were able to ask Darth Vader questions and receive a wide variety of responses. A lot of content creators posted humorous clips showcasing their interactions with the NPC, showing off its ability to help with everything from math homework to life advice. While the AI version of Darth Vader was popular with a large portion of the community, the organization SAG-AFTRA filed a lawsuit against Fortnite for its use of AI.

In a recent post on Twitter, the prominent leaker HYPEX shared information about two NPCs that have been added to the LEGO Fortnite Brick Life game mode. The NPCs, Slurp Leviathan and Noir, will be available through June 12 and provide commentary unique to the moment. At first glance, the NPCs don't seem to have the massive presence of Fortnite 's AI Darth Vader, but they do offer some of the same functionality, which has made some players wonder how SAG-AFTRA will respond.

Epic Games Adds Two AI NPCs to LEGO Fortnite Brick Life

The response from the community has been mixed, with some gamers in the comments of HYPEX's post stating that they would like to see Fortnite abandon this kind of AI. On the flip side, other fans claimed that Darth Vader was their favorite part of the Galactic Battle mini-season and would like to see more NPCs like that in the future. Either way, it seems as if Epic Games is pursuing this kind of technology more and more.

While the Galactic Battle mini-season may be over, Epic Games has announced that it will be bringing Star Wars content to the Unreal Editor in Fortnite . According to the developer, this will allow gamers to create their own Star Wars experiences while making use of iconic characters, locations, and weapons. It's all part of an initiative to expand Fortnite 's presence and put more power in the hands of the community. With so much content to explore and even more on the way, many fans are feeling optimistic about the future of Fortnite .

item.title: How to Get Aluminum in Dune: Awakening
item.description:
Aluminum makes up the fourth tier of equipment in Dune: Awakening , and this is where things really start to open up. Apart from the regular slew of new weapons and armor, Aluminum also enables the construction of Tier 4 tools and vehicle parts, including the schematics needed to make your first Ornithopter.

Getting Aluminum is going to be much harder compared to just harvesting Iron or Carbon. Apart from this resource being generally harder to reach, you'll also need advanced tools before you can even start mining them. Here's what you need to do and where you need to go to get Aluminum in Dune: Awakening.

Dune: Awakening - Aluminum Location

You can find Aluminum in the regions beyond Vermillius Gap. You can find some on the flat-top rock spires in Jabal Eifrit , but if you want to get as much Aluminum as possible, you'll want to get to the Eastern Shield Wall . The valleys here have plenty of Aluminum for you to harvest, but if you want to stockpile Aluminum Ingots as early as possible, Jabal Eifrit is a good place to start.

Before you can mine Aluminum Ore, you need a Cutterray Mk3 , and before you can use a Cutterray Mk3 efficiently, you'll need a Power Pack Mk3 to supply you with enough energy for continuous mining. Also, you should already have a Suspensor Belt equipped by this stage of the game — getting Suspensor Belt early is one of the best things you can do as a beginner. These will help you greatly when it comes to exploration and climbing tall obstacles.

There should be a couple of Aluminum Ore nodes on top of the marked spires above. Each node yields 40 Aluminum Ore with a Cutterray Mk3, and if you want to improve that efficiency, you'll need a better Cutterray. Also, keep in mind that ore nodes respawn at a fixed interval, so you'll technically never run out of Aluminum to mine.

Crafting Aluminum Ingots

To make Aluminum Ingots, you need a Medium Ore Refinery and the following materials:

  • 7 Aluminum Ore
  • 200 Water

Given the high Water requirement for a single bar of Aluminum as well as the 125 Steel Ingot/60 Cobalt Paste requirement for the Medium Ore Refinery, we suggest getting a decent water collection setup going first. Making a base near a big NPC camp is an easy way to harvest blood for purification, but if you want an automated water harvesting method early on, build some Windtraps in your base .

Water is defintely going to be your production bottleneck when crafting Aluminum-tier equipment and above, so make sure you don't neglect water generation and storage from hereon.

Dune: Awakening
